page.title: 03Technology,West Tytherley.
page.content: At this time,micro-computers are coming into homes,schools and offices. They are used for leisure,education and business.For individuals,the computer,disk drive and monitor remain expensive.Models are from BBC Acorn, Sinclair and Commodore.Software is tape or disk.Children enjoy games such as Space Invaders or Pacman.The Village School at Tytherley has two computers; one provided by parents.One model can be programmed to talk.Pupils write programmes in Basic for graphics speech and logical working. Microchips are used in calculators, electronic keyboards,watches,cameras, sewing machines,cars,etc. A small number of local people work for a firm which supplies main frame computers and associated software.
